versions.label: Introduced
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 AZ H 2175
Author: Willoughby
Version: Introduced
Version Date: 01/14/2025

REFERENCE TITLE: claims; prior authorization; conduct

State of Arizona

House of Representatives

Fifty-seventh Legislature

First Regular Session

2025

HB 2175

Introduced by

Representative Willoughby

AN ACT

AMENDING TITLE 20, CHAPTER 20, ARTICLE 1, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES, BY ADDING SECTION 20-3103; RELATING TO TIMELY PAYMENT OF HEALTH CARE INSURANCE CLAIMS.

Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:

Section 1. Title 20, chapter 20, article 1, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended by adding section 20-3103, to read:

20-3103. Denial of claims or prior authorization; health care provider review; unprofessional conduct; definition

A. EXCEPT FOR DENIALS FOR LACK OF ADMINISTRATIVE COMPLETENESS, MEMBER ENROLLMENT STATUS OR A DETERMINATION THAT A SERVICE OR PROVIDER TYPE IS CATEGORICALLY EXCLUDED FROM COVERAGE UNDER THE PLAN, A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER SHALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW EACH CLAIM FOR HEALTH CARE SERVICES BEFORE A HEALTH CARE INSURER DENIES A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION. ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE MAY NOT BE USED TO DENY A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION.

B. A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER THAT DENIES A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION WITHOUT AN INDIVIDUAL REVIEW OF THE CLAIM OR PRIOR AUTHORIZATION COMMITS AN ACT OF UNPROFESSIONAL CONDUCT.

C. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "HEALTH CARE PROVIDER" MEANS A PERSON WHO IS CERTIFIED OR LICENSED PURSUANT TO TITLE 32, CHAPTER 7, 8, 11, 13, 14, 15, 15.1, 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 21, 25, 28, 29, 33, 34, 35, 39, 41 OR 42, TITLE 36, CHAPTER 4, ARTICLE 6, TITLE 36, CHAPTER 6, ARTICLE 7 OR TITLE 36, CHAPTER 17.


Copyright © 2025 State Net

REFERENCE TITLE: claims; prior authorization; conduct

State of Arizona

House of Representatives

Fifty-seventh Legislature

First Regular Session

2025

HB 2175

Introduced by

Representative Willoughby

AN ACT

AMENDING TITLE 20, CHAPTER 20, ARTICLE 1, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES, BY ADDING
SECTION 20-3103; RELATING TO TIMELY PAYMENT OF HEALTH CARE INSURANCE CLAIMS.

Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:

Section 1. Title 20, chapter 20, article 1, Arizona Revised Statutes, is
amended by adding section 20-3103, to read:

_20-3103._Denial of claims or prior authorization; health care provider
review; unprofessional conduct; definition_ _

_A. EXCEPT FOR DENIALS FOR LACK OF ADMINISTRATIVE COMPLETENESS, MEMBER
ENROLLMENT STATUS OR A DETERMINATION THAT A SERVICE OR PROVIDER TYPE IS
CATEGORICALLY EXCLUDED FROM COVERAGE UNDER THE PLAN, A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER
SHALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW EACH CLAIM FOR HEALTH CARE SERVICES BEFORE A HEALTH
CARE INSURER DENIES A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION. ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE
MAY NOT BE USED TO DENY A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION._

_B. A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER THAT DENIES A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION
WITHOUT AN INDIVIDUAL REVIEW OF THE CLAIM OR PRIOR AUTHORIZATION COMMITS AN
ACT OF UNPROFESSIONAL CONDUCT._

_C. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "HEALTH CARE PROVIDER" MEANS A PERSON
WHO IS CERTIFIED OR LICENSED PURSUANT TO TITLE 32, CHAPTER 7, 8, 11, 13, 14,
15, 15.1, 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 21, 25, 28, 29, 33, 34, 35, 39, 41 OR 42,
TITLE 36, CHAPTER 4, ARTICLE 6, TITLE 36, CHAPTER 6, ARTICLE 7 OR TITLE 36,
CHAPTER 17._

versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 AZ H 2175
Author: Willoughby
Version: Engrossed House
Version Date: 02/17/2025

House Engrossed

claims; prior authorization; conduct

State of Arizona

House of Representatives

Fifty-seventh Legislature

First Regular Session

2025

HOUSE BILL 2175

AN ACT

AMENDING TITLE 20, CHAPTER 20, ARTICLE 1, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES, BY ADDING SECTION 20-3103; RELATING TO HEALTH CARE INSURANCE CLAIMS.

Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:

Section 1. Title 20, chapter 20, article 1, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended by adding section 20-3103, to read:

20-3103. Denial of claims or prior authorization; health care provider review; unprofessional conduct; definition

A. ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE MAY NOT BE USED TO DENY A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION FOR MEDICAL NECESSITY, EXPERIMENTAL STATUS OR ANY OTHER REASON THAT INVOLVES THE USE OF MEDICAL JUDGMENT.

B. A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER SHALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW EACH CLAIM OR PRIOR AUTHORIZATION THAT INVOLVES MEDICAL NECESSITY, EXPERIMENTAL STATUS OR THAT REQUIRES THE USE OF MEDICAL JUDGMENT BEFORE A HEALTH CARE INSURER MAY DENY A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION.

C. A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER THAT DENIES A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION WITHOUT AN INDIVIDUAL REVIEW OF THE CLAIM OR PRIOR AUTHORIZATION COMMITS AN ACT OF UNPROFESSIONAL CONDUCT.

D. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "HEALTH CARE PROVIDER" MEANS A PERSON WHO IS CERTIFIED OR LICENSED PURSUANT TO TITLE 32, CHAPTER 7, 8, 11, 13, 14, 15, 15.1, 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 21, 25, 28, 29, 33, 34, 35, 39, 41 OR 42, TITLE 36, CHAPTER 4, ARTICLE 6, TITLE 36, CHAPTER 6, ARTICLE 7 OR TITLE 36, CHAPTER 17 OR WHO HOLDS A SIMILAR LICENSE IN ANOTHER STATE.

Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:

Section 1. Title 20, chapter 20, article 1, Arizona Revised Statutes, is
amended by adding section 20-3103, to read:

_20-3103._Denial of claims or prior authorization; health care provider
review; unprofessional conduct; definition_ _

_A. ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE MAY NOT BE USED TO DENY A CLAIM OR A PRIOR
AUTHORIZATION FOR MEDICAL NECESSITY, EXPERIMENTAL STATUS OR ANY OTHER REASON
THAT INVOLVES THE USE OF MEDICAL JUDGMENT._

_B. A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER SHALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW EACH CLAIM OR PRIOR
AUTHORIZATION THAT INVOLVES MEDICAL NECESSITY, EXPERIMENTAL STATUS OR THAT

_C. A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER THAT DENIES A CLAIM OR A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION

ACT OF UNPROFESSIONAL CONDUCT._

_D. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "HEALTH CARE PROVIDER" MEANS A PERSON
WHO IS CERTIFIED OR LICENSED PURSUANT TO TITLE 32, CHAPTER 7, 8, 11, 13, 14,
15, 15.1, 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 21, 25, 28, 29, 33, 34, 35, 39, 41 OR 42,

versions.label: Amended - Striker
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2025 AZ H 2175
Author: Willoughby
Version: Amended - Striker
Version Date: 03/17/2025

Fifty-seventh Legislature

Finance

First Regular Session

H.B. 2175

COMMITTEE ON FINANCE

SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.B. 2175

(Reference to House engrossed bill)

Strike everything after the enacting clause and insert:

"Section 1. Title 20, chapter 15, article 1, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended by adding section 20-2512, to read:

20-2512. Denial of claims; provider review of claims

BEFORE A HEALTH CARE INSURER MAY DENY A CLAIM THAT WAS SUBMITTED BY A PROVIDER ON THE BASIS OF MEDICAL NECESSITY OR EXPERIMENTAL STATUS OR THAT REQUIRES THE USE OF MEDICAL JUDGMENT, THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR OR PROVIDER SHALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW THE DENIAL. DURING EACH INDIVIDUAL REVIEW, THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR OR PROVIDER SHALL EXERCISE INDEPENDENT MEDICAL JUDGMENT AND MAY NOT RELY SOLELY ON RECOMMENDATIONS FROM ANY OTHER SOURCE.

Sec. 2. Title 20, chapter 26, article 1, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended by adding section 20-3407, to read:

20-3407. Denial of prior authorization: provider review of prior authorization

BEFORE A HEALTH CARE INSURER MAY ISSUE A DIRECT DENIAL OF A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION OF A SERVICE THAT WAS REQUESTED BY A PROVIDER AND THAT INVOLVES MEDICAL NECESSITY OR EXPERIMENTAL STATUS OR THAT REQUIRES THE USE OF MEDICAL JUDGMENT, THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR OR PROVIDER SHALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW THE DENIAL. DURING EACH INDIVIDUAL REVIEW, THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR OR PROVIDER SHALL EXERCISE INDEPENDENT MEDICAL JUDGMENT AND MAY NOT RELY SOLELY ON RECOMMENDATIONS FROM ANY OTHER SOURCE.

Sec. 3. Effective date

This act is effective from and after June 30, 2026."

Amend title to conform

2175FIN.docx

03/13/2025

2:38 PM

C: SK


Copyright © 2025 State Net

HOUSE BILL 2175

AN ACT

AMENDING TITLE 20, CHAPTER 20, ARTICLE 1, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES, BY ADDING SECTION 20-3103; AMENDING TITLE 20, CHAPTER 26, ARTICLE 1, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES, BY ADDING SECTION 20-3407; RELATING TO INSURANCE.

Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:

Section 1. Title 20, chapter 20, article 1, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended by adding section 20-3103, to read:

20-3103. Denial of claims; review of claims

BEFORE A HEALTH CARE INSURER MAY DENY A CLAIM THAT WAS SUBMITTED BY A PROVIDER ON THE BASIS OF MEDICAL NECESSITY, THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR SHALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW THE DENIAL. DURING EACH INDIVIDUAL REVIEW, THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR SHALL EXERCISE INDEPENDENT MEDICAL JUDGMENT AND MAY NOT RELY SOLELY ON RECOMMENDATIONS FROM ANY OTHER SOURCE.

Sec. 2. Title 20, chapter 26, article 1, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended by adding section 20-3407, to read:

20-3407. Denial of prior authorization; review of prior authorization

BEFORE A HEALTH CARE INSURER MAY ISSUE A DIRECT DENIAL OF A PRIOR AUTHORIZATION OF A SERVICE THAT WAS REQUESTED BY A PROVIDER AND THAT INVOLVES MEDICAL NECESSITY, THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR SHALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW THE DENIAL. DURING EACH INDIVIDUAL REVIEW, THE MEDICAL DIRECTOR SHALL EXERCISE INDEPENDENT MEDICAL JUDGMENT AND MAY NOT RELY SOLELY ON RECOMMENDATIONS FROM ANY OTHER SOURCE.

Sec. 3. Effective date

This act is effective from and after June 30, 2026.
